column4: hi fellows > I have this problem > I cannot see the router index page when browsing from ubuntu server ( terminal mode ) with either w3m or lynx ....they display some d234.gif information but I cannot see that pictures ...even so ..I think this is graphical from the frames but not the real content of the page ....what can I do ???
bare in mind that neither of those browsers support javascript, which most of router UIs use.
grrrrr > thanks for the tip .....any workaround ?
hm, well lynx has a basic support for frames... but workaround... hm, not that I know of.
if your router supports ssh maybe handle things that way?
if it would :D but is not the case .....it's a D-link product ....with proprietary firmware
Can you be specific on what you want to do with your router?
is there any version of X .....something light which I can use as "virtual" system .....?
I miss some info like the IP of one specific computer on the network .....and I want to "see" the configuration page :D
Well, in theory (since I never done it), you can install VBox or KVM and then connect through ssh tunnel to a remote desktop.
I don;t know if it works ...VBox needs X to be installed .....if I'd had this on the server I would not need the virtualisation .....
I just found out that Elinks and Links2 support javascript. Check them out.
cool man > thanks for that info ...let me check
Not sure how they managed to do that :) though.
I'll let you know in a minute
Then the problem might not be in JavaScript support.
